moves.1. d4 Nf6 2. c4: i almost always open d4-c4 as white
moves.3... Nbd7: develop, locking in his bishop unless he goes to b7
moves.7. Bd3: developing to defend the pawns again
moves.8... cxd5 9. cxd5: fine pawn strucutre still for me but
moves.9... Nxd5: brilliant tactic by him to win a pawn. I believe that there is nothing I could have done; as I analyzed many lines; correct me if i'm wrong
moves.10. Nxd5 Bxg5: I wanted my knight at d5 which is the reason I took there
moves.12... Bh6: he retreats, favoring a bishop over a knight. That spot would be a strong spot for his bishop never allowing me to bring my rooks to c1 during the game on to the open final
moves.13... Nxd3 14. Qxd3: uggh im down a pawn and have a knight pair rather than a bishop pair so im down around 1.5 points
moves.15... Qd7: he defends and offers a trade
moves.16... Rac8 17. Nd2: I try and bring my knight to attack the pawns
moves.17... Bxd5 18. Qxd5: he gives up the bishop pair
moves.21... b6: i really want to get to c1 but I cant
moves.23. g3: i forget why I played this, maybe so i can get my rook on d1 off the back rank
moves.24. Kg2: ? i move my king, maybe i didnt want any forced trades as im down a pawn and want to make it complicated
moves.29. Nh4: I lose another pawn but attack f5 hoping he doesnt see it
moves.30. Ra2: I want to get onto the c column
moves.33. Rxd6 b5: now after all the pawn takes im down two pawns in what seems to be a lost end game
moves.34. Nxf5: yes one pawn back with this supposed tactic but...
moves.34... Bf8: great move I didnt see and now I am really done
moves.35. Rf6 gxf5 36. Rxf5: I am down a whole piece now
moves.36... Bxb4 37. Rxe5: he takes, i take we both have passed pawns
moves.39... h6 40. Rg6 Kh7 41. Rb6: I get behind his pawns making it difficult
moves.42... b4 43. Kf3: I try and get my king into the action
moves.43... Ra3+: he checks and will push again
moves.46. Rb7+: I check and begin to come up with a strategy to lock  the king on the last row. if he played bg7 then f6
moves.46... Kg8 47. Ke5: I move the king forward and a plan really starts to come together
moves.49. Kg6: I get opposition and see a small glimmer of hope
moves.49... Ra2: He must've seen my idea but believed he would be okay
moves.51. Rb8: ! only one move can save him
moves.51... b1=Q+: ! Noooo he finds it. I must take
moves.53. f7+: f7+!! best move for me; pretty much forces a draw froma position that should be lost and in fact it gains me the win as he resigns
moves.53... Kh8: only move and he resigns mistakenly. I would have played Rb8 but after Rxg3+ Kf6 Rf3+ he can get three move repetition. Please comment any observations and whether or not he should have resigned.
